conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a costume drama movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text: I'd highly recommend "Dances with Wolves" if you're in the mood for a captivating costume drama. This film follows John Dunbar, a Civil War soldier who forms an unlikely friendship with a Sioux tribe, and it stars Kevin Costner and Mary McDonnell. Another great choice is "The Great Debaters," which tells the true story of a professor who inspires his students to form a debate team and challenge Harvard in the national championship. Denzel Washington plays one of the lead roles in this thought-provoking movie. Both films are sure to provide an engaging and enriching viewing experience!

Based on your interest in movies with deeper themes and intriguing characters, I'd highly recommend you watch "Uptown Girls" starring Marley Shelton and Heather Locklear. The story revolves around a grown woman who keeps her childish instincts and becomes a nanny to an 8-year-old girl acting like an adult.

If you enjoy the sound of that, you might also appreciate "It's a Wonderful Life" from 1946 starring James Stewart and Donna Reed. This heartwarming classic tells the story of an angel guiding a frustrated businessman to see the impact he's made on his community. Both movies offer engaging plots that may appeal to your tastes!

I'd highly recommend "Moulin Rouge!" if you're into dance and intriguing plots. This film combines romance, drama, and a unique blend of contemporary pop music with classic musicals, all set against the backdrop of the Parisian Montmartre cabaret in the late 19th century. Starring Ewan McGregor and Nicole Kidman, their dynamic performances add depth to this visually stunning movie experience.

On a different note, "Alex in Wonderland" is an intriguing film that explores the world of filmmaking and the challenges artists face when balancing artistic freedom with commercial success. With stars like Jeanne Moreau and Paul Mazursky, it's definitely worth watching if you enjoy movies about the movie industry.

If you're in the mood for dance, I'd highly recommend "Step Up" (2006). It's a heartwarming story about two dancers from different worlds who come together and create something magical. Channing Tatum and Jenna Dewan star in this film that's sure to get your feet tapping!

On the other hand, if you fancy a mix of comedy and time travel, "Hot Tub Time Machine" (2010) could be just what you need. This hilarious film follows four friends who accidentally travel back in time and must relive a fateful night to ensure the future is set right. John Cusack, Rob Corddry, and Craig Robinson bring the laughs in this fun-filled adventure!

It sounds like you might enjoy "Smilla's Sense of Snow" and "Prometheus".

"Smilla's Sense of Snow" is a gripping mystery that follows Smilla, a half Inuit living in Copenhagen, as she uncovers the truth behind the death of a young boy from her building. This film showcases a strong female lead and has a suspenseful plot that keeps you on the edge of your seat.

"Prometheus", on the other hand, is a contemporary sci-fi thriller set in end-of-millennium Britain and continental Europe. It explores humanity's use and misuse of technology and power, featuring an all-star cast including Noomi Rapace, Michael Fassbender, and Charlize Theron.

I'd highly recommend "Shark Tale" for you! This animated movie is filled with humor and adventure, featuring an ensemble voice cast including Robert De Niro and Martin Scorsese. The story revolves around a series of misunderstandings in the oceanic world that lead to unexpected alliances. It might just surprise you emotionally too!

If you're up for something different, "Cars" is another wonderful choice. This Pixar film offers a unique blend of adventure and life lessons, with an impressive cast including Owen Wilson, Larry the Cable Guy, and Paul Newman. The story follows a hotshot race car who learns that winning isn't everything in life – it's about friendship and teamwork. Enjoy the ride!
